results.title: Tumbling and floor exercises
results.creator_credit: Associated Film Services and Jan Sadlo
results.brief_description: Demonstrates proper techniques in various tumbling and floor exercise skills. The moves are then shown together as a series of movements to emphasise proper composition of routines. From basic to intermediate difficulty.

results.title: Tumbleweeds
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An dramatic look at the trouble faced by a teenage couple. The girl finds out that she is pregnant and has decided to give it up for adoption. The boy still loves her and they must face making the final decision together.

results.title: Tumanu's people
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Morris
results.brief_description: Documents Commonwealth Government assistance to the Aboriginal people of the Northern Territory in 1960. Shows the contrast between the old aboriginal way of life, which is gone for ever and the new. Stresses the progress made over recent years, the difficulties of older people adjusting to big changes and how the children will be those to enjoy the new life.

results.title: Tullamarine: Melbourne airport
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell, AVEC Film and Ivan Gaal
results.brief_description: About the operational and sociological role of a modern airport in the life of people who pass through it and work in it. Follows the arrival of Qantas flight QF2 and departure QF1. Non-narrated.

results.title: Tullamarine project [original cut]
results.brief_description: A crowd waves goodbye to a T.A.A. flight at Essendon Airport, aerial shots of the City of Melbourne and Yarra River. late developmental stages of construction on the Tullamarine Airport and Freeway. Shot in October 1968.

results.title: Tulips and spring bulbs
results.creator_credit: Stuart Crowner, Bruce Franchini and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
The vast, colourful bulb fields of our host audrey Hepburn’s native Holland are only a small part of a complex cultural phenomenon. Here bulbs are intertwined with the history and art of an entire country. The transformation from sleeping bulb to elegant bloom is miraculous. Narcissus, hyacinth, muscari and bluebells share the stage with the favourite, the tulip, for a grand tour of the spectacular Kreukenhof in Holland and Chenics Manor, in England and more. Hosted by Audrey Hepburn and narrated by Michael York.

results.title: Tulip
results.creator_credit: Louise Smith, Rachel Griffiths, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Shaun Farrington, Helen Campbell and Scott Bradley
results.brief_description: William (Bud Tingwell), has just lost his wife, Ruth, after forty-five years of marriage. In the days after her death he tries to adjust to life alone, but must first solve the dilemma of how to milk her cow, Tulip. Music by David Bridie.
